newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London close slightly firmer.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London close slightly firmer.

text.p: Japanese stocks were slightly firmer on Tuesday in thin trading in London, with any upside potential weighed down by an overall weaker London market, dealers said.
"It has been a pretty quiet day", one trader said, adding European trading would not reflect the surge of the Nikkei in Tokyo.
On Tuesday, Tokyo's Nikkei 225 index marked a new high for 1997, ending at 20,563.16, up 111.31 points or 0.54 percent. It was the highest close since December 11, 1996.
Fujitsu was up 21.5 yen to 1,464 but back from a new year's high of 1,467.5. Fujitsu's shares closed at 1,470 yen in Tokyo, up 20.
Computer giant NEC was up 20 Yen to 1,650, the same as Tokyo's closing price.
